title: QA Correspondence Map: Hans Kayser Harmonik
epistemology_note: This is a MAPPING artifact, not a VALIDATION certificate. Correspondences are structural and interpretive unless tagged otherwise. Numerical certificates may be derived in future phases.

source_artifacts.title: Lehrbuch der Harmonik
source_artifacts.author: Hans Kayser
source_artifacts.note: Primary source for harmonic theory diagrams
Scanned pages: Proportionen, Kosmogonie, Rhythmus, Conics, Projection, Primordial Leaf
Third-party engineering connection: laser physicist linking Kayser diagrams to JWST anastigmat and dye laser cavities

evidence_levels.PROVEN: Mathematical isomorphism demonstrated with explicit mapping
evidence_levels.ENGINEERING_VALIDATED: Independent third-party connection to physical/engineering systems
evidence_levels.STRUCTURAL_ANALOGY: Corresponding organizational patterns; not yet numerically verified

correspondences.qa_concept: Modular arithmetic grid / state space lattice
correspondences.description: The Lambdoma is a ratio matrix where rows/columns represent harmonic intervals (1/1, 1/2, 2/1, etc.). QA's mod-N state space similarly organizes states by arithmetic relationships. Both exhibit diagonal symmetries and generate hierarchical substructures.
correspondences.upgrade_path: Map Lambdoma ratios to mod-24 cycle periods; check if harmonic series 1:2:3:4:... corresponds to QA orbit structure

correspondences.qa_concept: Generator algebra / APEIRON as pattern space
correspondences.description: Kayser's T-shaped cosmogonic diagram with APEIRON (unlimited) at the origin maps conceptually to QA's pattern space Omega from which finite structures emerge via generators. The Greek distinction APEIRON/PERAS (unlimited/limited) parallels deployed/condensed states.
correspondences.upgrade_path: Formalize APEIRON as QA pattern space; map T-cross branches to generator classes

correspondences.description: Kayser's rhythmic notation patterns and circular tone diagrams directly parallel QA's cyclic orbit structure. Musical meter (3/4, 4/4, etc.) corresponds to mod-3, mod-4 arithmetic. The radial diagram resembles QA's 24-cycle Cosmos orbit visualization.
correspondences.upgrade_path: Compare Kayser's tone circle intervals to QA orbit transition frequencies

correspondences.description: Kayser shows conic sections arising from harmonic projections. QA's three-orbit structure (Cosmos, Satellite, Singularity) may correspond to elliptical, hyperbolic, and parabolic basin types. The nested ellipses in kayser4 visually resemble QA orbit nesting.
correspondences.upgrade_path: Classify QA orbits by conic section type; check if basin boundaries follow conic equations

correspondences.description: Kayser's leaf diagram shows harmonic ratios branching from a monochord string. This resembles QA proof tree structures where theorems branch from axioms. The organic leaf shape suggests self-similar growth patterns.
correspondences.upgrade_path: Map leaf branch points to QA state transitions; check for fractal dimension correspondence

correspondences.description: Independent third-party (laser physics engineer) connected Kayser's conic diagrams to: (1) JWST's 3-mirror anastigmat (parabola primary, hyperbola secondary, ellipse tertiary), (2) Dye laser elliptical pump cavities. This provides real-world engineering validation that Kayser's harmonic geometry manifests in precision optical systems.
engineering_refs: James Webb Space Telescope optical design
correspondences.upgrade_path: Document JWST mirror equations; compare to Kayser's harmonic ratios

meta_correspondence.kayser_program: Harmonic ratios underlie natural phenomena from crystals to cosmos
meta_correspondence.qa_program: Modular arithmetic with geometric invariants underlies signal processing, neural networks, and theorem generation
meta_correspondence.synthesis: Both frameworks assert that discrete ratio/proportion structures generate continuous phenomena. Kayser approached this through acoustics and music theory; QA approaches through computational invariants and E8 alignment.

historical_context.relevance_to_qa: Kayser represents the 20th century's most systematic attempt to formalize Pythagorean harmonic theory. His work was largely ignored by mainstream physics but anticipated modern interests in geometric unity and ratio-based physics. QA can be seen as a computational completion of Kayser's program.

upgrade_roadmap.condition: When explicit numerical mappings are established
